title.narrative: Improve the lives and well-being of People with Specific Needs (PSNs) through the provision of timely, appropriate response in Nduta, Mtendeli, Kibondo and Nyarugusu Refugee camps

description.narrative: This project seeks to extend improved access to specialised care, protection and humanitarian assistance to all persons with specific needs (PSN) from among the Burundian refugees arriving and living in Nduta and Mtendeli refugee camps of Kibondo and Kakonko districts, Kigoma region. The PSNs consist of vulnerable older men and women; women and men with disability, and children, those living with chronic medical conditions, single women living on their own and minorities such as Albinos, through appropriate identification and referral systems as well community rehabilitation programmes, protection and promotion of community and home-based care to homebound and frail PSNs. The project also aims to increase awareness among humanitarian actors by building skills and capacity promoting minimum standards for age and disability inclusion in humanitarian services in the camps.
